alert.note: Alert for Martin; Okeechobee; St. Lucie (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 13 at 3:30AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Locally Dense Fog Has Developed From Lake Okeechobee to the Southern Treasure Coast Counties... At 330 AM, surface observations, traffic cameras and satellite imagery showed locally dense fog had developed across Martin and southern Okeechobee and Saint Lucie Counties. This includes the cities of Okeechobee, Port Saint Lucie, Stuart, and Indiantown. Visibilities in this area will occasionally drop to as low as one quarter mile. Persons driving on area roads such as Interstate 95, the Florida Turnpike, U.S. Highway 98 and State Highways 70, 76, 710 and 714 should expect to encounter dense fog reducing visibilities dropping to one quarter mile or less at times. If driving in dense fog, slow down, use your low beam headlights and leave extra driving distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you. The fog should burn off between 800 and 900 AM.
